Description: Rim (plain, incurving) and body sherd of North Ionian pottery bird bowl; interior glazed with an added red band lined in white; exterior: part of hatched lozenge with a glaze blob to its right; to the right three thin vertical lines separating the panels and part of a single vertical; at break lower right trace of diagonal glaze; top of rim on the exterior glazed.
Curator's comments: Very probably from the same vase as GR1924.12-1.882. For parallels, see Cambridge NA1.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 46.2.6)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 255, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.065)
